content: The "SCORE for Small Business Act of 2018" authorizes appropriations for the SCORE program to support small businesses. The program is allocated $10,500,000 for each fiscal year in 2019 and 2020. Section 8 of the Small Business Act is amended to specify the SCORE program and its definitions. The SCORE program receives funding to support small businesses. The SCORE program, authorized by subsection (b)(1)(B), is managed by the SCORE Association through a grant from the Administrator. Volunteers in the program offer free counseling, mentoring, and coaching to individuals involved in small businesses. The SCORE program offers free counseling, mentoring, and coaching for small business owners. It aims to provide low-cost education workshops and utilize resources from other organizations to support individuals in rural areas. The Administrator and SCORE Association work together to develop plans and goals for more effective service delivery. The SCORE Association provides services to individuals in rural areas and economically disadvantaged communities, including electronic initiatives, web-based initiatives, chapter expansion, partnerships, and skills development for volunteers.SCORE must submit an annual report to the Administrator detailing the number of individuals counseled or trained, hours of counseling provided, and the formation of small business concerns with SCORE's assistance. The SCORE program assists small business concerns in expanding and creating jobs. Privacy requirements prohibit disclosing personal information without consent, except in specific legal circumstances. The Administrator may disclose information for criminal enforcement or financial audit purposes. This does not restrict access to program data or prevent the use of client information for surveys. The Administrator will establish standards for financial audit disclosures and client surveys, ensuring maximum privacy protection. SEC. 4. ONLINE COMPONENT. The SCORE Association will utilize online counseling, webinars, and an electronic mentoring platform to enhance access to services for entrepreneurs. A report on the effectiveness of these online components will be issued at the end of fiscal year 2019. The SCORE program utilizes online counseling, webinars, and electronic mentoring to support entrepreneurs. The program includes determining mentoring and webinar needs, developing training, establishing criteria, evaluating results, internal controls, webinar topics, and performance metrics. The terms "SCORE Association" and "SCORE program" are defined under the Small Business Act. The Small Business Act defines the "SCORE Association" and "SCORE program." A study and report on the future role of the SCORE program is required. The SCORE Association will conduct a study and develop a strategic plan for the SCORE program's future role in meeting small business needs over a 5-year period. A report with findings, the strategic plan, and implementation details will be issued to relevant committees within 6 months of the enactment of this Act. The SCORE Association will develop a strategic plan for the SCORE program's future, detailing how to achieve it with stagnant or increased funding levels. Definitions for "SCORE Association" and "SCORE program" are provided in the Small Business Act. SEC. 6. TECHNICAL AND CONFORMING AMENDMENTS. The Small Business Act is amended to replace "Service Corps of Retired Executives" with "SCORE program" in various sections. The Small Business Act is amended to replace "Service Corps of Retired Executives" with "SCORE program" in various sections, including the Small Business Reauthorization Act of 1997 and the Veterans Entrepreneurship and Small Business Development Act of 1999. The Entrepreneurship and Small Business Development Act of 1999 is amended to replace "Service Core of Retired Executives" with "SCORE program" in various sections. This includes the Military Reservist and Veteran Small Business Reauthorization and Opportunity Act of 2008 and the Children's Health Insurance Program Reauthorization Act of 2009. The SCORE program, authorized by the Small Business Act, replaces "Service Corps of Retired Executives" in various sections including the Energy Policy and Conservation Act. The House of Representatives passed the bill on July 10, 2018. Karen L. Haas attested as the Clerk.
